name: @beyond-js/events
title: Event Emitter Library for JavaScript - Create event-driven architecture in any environment
description: Event Emitter Library for JavaScript. It allows you to create objects that can generate events based on certain actions, and other objects can subscribe and unsubscribe to these events, making it easy for the developer to execute tasks based on the events being fired. This library is versatile and can be used in any environment, not just in Node or on the web. It can be used to implement an event-driven architecture, even on the client-side. It is particularly useful in view libraries like React, Vue, or Svelte, where it can be used to create reactive models that trigger events and update views accordingly.
author: BeyondJS
